Vlaknine za zdravo, dolgo življenje
Prehranske vlaknine so pomembne za nadzorovanje ravni sladkorja v krvi, nižajo slabi holesterol; pojedli naj bi jih 30 gramov na dan.
03 Nov 2019, 15:37 by U. S.
Milijoni ljudi tvegajo prezgodnjo smrt, ker ne jedo dovolj prehranskih vlaknin, kažejo izsledki večje študije, ki so jo opravili raziskovalci z univerz Otago na Novi Zelandiji in Dundee na Škotskem. Posamezniki, ki pojedo dovolj prehranskih vlaknin, znižajo tveganje prezgodnje smrti za tretjino, za četrtino pa tveganje infarkta, kapi, diabetesa tipa 2 in črevesnega raka.Prehranske vlaknine so nujne za prebavo, saj preprečujejo zaprtje, poleg tega skrbijo za sitost ter tako preprečujejo debelost, saj se izogibamo prigrizkom. Veliko jih je v sadju, zelenjavi pa v žitih, tudi kruhu in testeninah, narejenih iz polnozrnate moke.


Za primeren vnos poskrbimo z uživanjem sadja, zelenjave in polnozrnatih žit. FOTO: Guliver/Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES/ISTOCKPHOTO

A jih zaradi vse več predelanih živil pojemo manj, svoj delež prispevajo tudi trendovske diete z manj ogljikovimi hidrati in brez glutena. Raziskovalec John Cummings, profesor z univerze Dundee, pravi, da bo imela raziskava, objavljena v publikaciji Lancet, velik vpliv! Gre za ključen trenutek v zgodbi o vlakninah, pravi: »Dovolj dokazov imamo, da z gotovostjo govorimo o jasnih koristih prehranskih vlaknin za zdravje. So nujno hranilo.«Večina ljudi po svetu jih zaužije manj kot 20 g na dan, priporočen dnevni vnos za odrasle je 30 gramov, lahko preberemo na portalu prehrana.si. Raziskovalci so po naročilu Svetovne zdravstvene organizacije (da bodo objavili uradna priporočila o količini vlaknin, ki naj bi jih jedli za zdravje) proučili rezultate več kot 230 študij (185 študij in 58 kliničnih raziskav), v katerih je sodelovalo 215.000 ljudi. Ugotovili so, da imajo ljudje, ki pojedo več kot 30 g prehranskih vlaknin na dan, za 24 odstotkov manjše tveganje smrti zaradi katerega koli vzroka kot tisti, ki jih zaužijejo le 8 gramov na dan. Tveganje je nižje kar za tretjino pri tistih, ki jih pojedo 35 gramov dnevno.Da bi jih zaužili dovolj, bi morali biti krompir, testenine, kruh in drugi škrobnati ogljikovi hidrati glavne sestavine zdrave prehrane. Izogibati se moramo predelanim izdelkom in izbirati polnozrnate, saj ti vsebujejo veliko prehranskih vlaknin in bi morali biti pomemben del naše vsakodnevne prehrane. Kakovost pred količino, torej.
Ljudje, ki zaužijejo več prehranskih vlaknin, imajo manjše tveganje za nastanek koronarne srčne bolezni, kapi, sladkorne bolezni, debelosti in nekaterih bolezni prebavil.
Povišati količino vlaknin v naši prehrani ni lahko, to je za marsikoga velik izziv. Kako dosežemo 30 gramov na dan? Bel kruh in pekovsko pecivo zamenjajmo s polnozrnatimi, prav tako testenine. V juhe, omake ali solate dodajamo fižol, čičeriko, lečo, čokoladno ploščico zamenjamo s sadjem in oreški. Skodelica ovsa vsebuje 9 gramov vlaknin, debelejši kos temnega kruha dva grama, 100 g leče 17 gramov, 100 g korenja 3 grame, jabolka (z lupino vred) 4 grame.

Fiber for a healthy, long life
Dietary fiber is important for controlling blood sugar levels, lowering bad cholesterol; they should eat 30 grams a day.
03 Nov 2019, 15:37 by U. S.
Millions of people risk premature death by not eating enough dietary fiber, according to a major study by researchers from Otago Universities in New Zealand and Dundee in Scotland. Individuals who eat enough dietary fiber reduce their risk of premature death by one-third and one-quarter the risk of heart attack, stroke, type 2 diabetes and intestinal cancer. Dietary fiber is essential for digestion, preventing constipation, and additionally providing care for obesity , as we avoid snacks. Many are in fruits and vegetables in cereals, including bread and pasta made from whole grain flour.


The intake of fruits, vegetables and whole grains is a good way of eating. PHOTO: Gulliver / Getty ImagesGETTY IMAGES / ISTOCKPHOTO

But as more processed foods are eaten less, trendy, low-carb, and gluten-free diets also contribute to their share. Researcher John Cummings, a professor at Dundee University, says the research published in the Lancet publication will have a huge impact! This is a pivotal moment in the fiber story, he says: “There is enough evidence to say with certainty the clear benefits of dietary fiber to health. Most people in the world consume less than 20 grams a day, the recommended daily intake for adults is 30 grams, you can read on the portal prehrana.si. Researchers have examined the results of more than 230 studies (185 studies and 58 clinical studies) involving 215,000 people, commissioned by the World Health Organization (to publish official recommendations on the amount of fiber they should eat for health). People who eat more than 30g of dietary fiber a day were found to have a 24 percent lower risk of death from any cause than those who consume only 8 grams a day. The risk is lower by as much as a third for those who eat 35 grams a day.To eat enough, potatoes, pasta, bread and other starchy carbohydrates should be the main ingredients of a healthy diet. We should avoid processed products and choose whole grains, as they contain a lot of dietary fiber and should be an important part of our daily diet. Quality over quantity, therefore.
People who consume more dietary fiber are less likely to develop coronary heart disease, stroke, diabetes, obesity and some gastrointestinal diseases.
Increasing the amount of fiber in our diet is not easy, which is a big challenge for many. How to get 30 grams a day? Replace white bread and baked goods with whole grains, as well as pasta. Add beans, chickpeas, lentils to the soups, sauces or salads, and replace the chocolate bar with fruits and nuts. A cup of oats contains 9 grams of fiber, a thicker piece of dark bread two grams, 100 grams of lentils 17 grams, 100 grams of carrots 3 grams, apples (with peel) 4 grams.
